newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul plans to give $10 mln to N.Korea in new aid.
newsitem.headline: Seoul plans to give $10 mln to N.Korea in new aid.

text.p: South Korea has decided to offer about $10 million in fresh food aid to North Korea but the exact amount would depend on Pyongyang' response to a peace proposal, a government official said on Saturday.

"We have reached an internal agreement that an additional donation to the World Food Programme will be around $10 million," the official said, referring to a $95.5 million aid appeal by the U.N. body.

The official, who asked not to be identified, told Reuters that an announcement on the additional aid would be made only after North Korea responded to a joint U.S.-South Korean proposal for four-nation peace talks, which include China.
Seoul had already contributed $6 million to the programme before the appeal was increased from an earlier $41.6 million.
"The amount could be reduced by a couple of million dollars if we are not happy with the North's response," he said.

North Korea is due to give an answer to the peace proposal in a meeting with the United States and South Korea later on Saturday. The peace talks aim to secure a lasting peace on the Korean peninsula to replace a truce agreement that ended the 1950-53 Korean War.
